data.meta_description:

We lost both mega-mogul Samuel Goldwyn and mega-funnyman Jack Benny - Talk about having a great year...Mel Brooks directed/released two of the...
data.text:
1974...

We lost both mega-mogul Samuel Goldwyn and mega-funnyman Jack Benny - Talk about having a great year...Mel Brooks directed/released two of the greatest comedies of all time; Blazing Saddles and Young Frankenstein - History in the making; Hammerin' Hank hit number 715

Please try to do a top 10 in order (hard as it may be) with an optional two or three "honorable mentions".

The Callaghan Best Films of 1974 List:

01 The Godfather Part II

02 Blazing Saddles

03 That’s Entertainment

04 Chinatown

05 Murder on the Orient Express

06 Young Frankenstein

07 The Towering Inferno

08 Earthquake

09 The Sugarland Express

10 The Man With The Golden Gun

Honorable Mentions:

-The Four Musketeers

-The Conversation

-Harry and Tonto

Also...

The Oscars; Who Won, and Who Shoulda Won IMHO

Best Picture

Who Won: The Godfather Part II

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Director

Who Won: Francis Ford Coppola (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Actor

Who Won: Art Carney (Harry and Tonto)

Shoulda Won: Al Pacino (The Godfather Part II)

Best Actress

Who Won: Ellen Burstyn (Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore)

Shoulda Won: Faye Dunaway (Chinatown)

Best Supporting Actor

Who Won: Robert De Niro (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Supporting Actress

Who Won: Ingrid Bergman (Murder on the Orient Express)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Cinematography

Who Won: Fred J. Koenekamp and Joseph F. Biroc (The Towering Inferno)

Shoulda Won: Gordon Willis (The Godfather Part II) *Not even nominated

Best Score

Who Won: Nino Rota and Carmine Coppola (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Forgot Which Films Came Out That Year?

Have No Fear - The IMDB Is Here...

http://us.imdb.com/List?year=1974&&...ing=7;Most popular titles;1974 by total votes

Also...

Shoulda Won: I concur

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Actor

Who Won: Art Carney (Harry and Tonto)

Shoulda Won: Al Pacino (The Godfather Part II)

Best Actress

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Supporting Actor

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Supporting Actress

Who Won: Ingrid Bergman (Murder on the Orient Express)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Score

Who Won: Nino Rota and Carmine Coppola (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

I was 4 years old in 1974. Can you believe, to this day, I have never seen Chinatown ? (Gasp)

The Hudson Best Films of 1974 List:

01 The Godfather Part II

02 TheYoung Frankenstein

03 The Conversation

04 Longest Yard, The

05 Texas Chainsaw Massacre, The

06 Towering Inferno

07 Sugarland Express, The

08 Murder on the Orient Express

09 Blazing Saddles

10 Three Musketeers, The

Also...

The Oscars; Who Won, and Who Shoulda Won IMHO

Best Picture

Who Won: The Godfather Part II

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Director

Who Won: Francis Ford Coppola (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Actor

Who Won: Art Carney (Harry and Tonto)

Shoulda Won: Al Pacino (The Godfather Part II)

Best Actress

Who Won: Ellen Burstyn (Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore)

Shoulda Won: Faye Dunaway (Chinatown)

Best Supporting Actor

Who Won: Robert De Niro (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur

Best Supporting Actress

Who Won: Ingrid Bergman (Murder on the Orient Express)

Shoulda Won: Gena Rowlands (A Woman Under the Influence)

Best Cinematography

Who Won: Fred J. Koenekamp and Joseph F. Biroc (The Towering Inferno)

Shoulda Won: Gordon Willis (The Godfather Part II) *Not even nominated Wasn't even nominated for The Godfather (Original!) WTF

Best Score

Who Won: Nino Rota and Carmine Coppola (The Godfather Part II)

Shoulda Won: I concur
